newsitem.title: UK: Amoco pulls 42 off N.Sea platform as gas builds up.
newsitem.headline: Amoco pulls 42 off N.Sea platform as gas builds up.

text.p: Amoco Corp has pulled 42 employees off its Lomond platform in the North Sea as a precaution after an unexplained gas pressure build up, a spokesman for the company said on Monday.
He said that Amoco had been bringing the well back into production at the weekend, when shortly after 0800 GMT on Monday the pressure build-up was noticed.

The decision was then taken to evacuate the platform. By 1600 GMT, 42 of the 59 employees had been airlifted off, with a further 17 people still on board. A helicopter and a ship, the Grampian Shield, are both on standby as a precautionary measure.
The spokesman added that at this stage Amoco has no idea of what has caused the pressure build up, but he added that the company hopes production will not be stopped for long.
